name: Harvey Dent
description: Harvey Dent is Gotham City's district attorney who becomes the villainous Two-Face after a tragic disfigurement, embodying the duality of justice and chaos.

content.title: Background
content.body: Harvey Dent is a dedicated and idealistic district attorney serving Gotham City. He initially upholds the law with a strong moral code and a fierce determination to rid the city of crime and corruption. His efforts see him as the 'White Knight' of Gotham, fighting to bring justice to a city long plagued by villainy.

content.title: Personality
content.body: Dent is characterized by his determination, ambition, and strong sense of justice, which initially drive him in his career as a district attorney. However, these traits also conceal his darker side; as Two-Face, he displays a split personality driven by chaos and a fixation on the concept of chance, making decisions based on the flip of a coin.

content.title: Story Role
content.body: In 'The Dark Knight', Harvey Dent begins as an ally to Batman and Commissioner Gordon in their efforts to dismantle organized crime. However, after a tragic encounter that leaves him physically and mentally scarred, Dent transforms into 'Two-Face', a villain obsessed with duality and chance. This transformation represents the key thematic conflict in the film between order and chaos.

content.title: Relationships
content.body:
- **Bruce Wayne/Batman**: Harvey initially sees Batman as a necessary figure in the fight against crime, although his view changes post-transformation.
- **Jim Gordon**: Dent works closely with Gordon, sharing a mutual respect and goal to bring down crime.
- **Rachel Dawes**: Dent's romantic interest, Rachel's fate deeply affects him and catalyzes his transformation into Two-Face.
- **The Joker**: Key antagonist who manipulates events leading to Dent's transformation.
